Author: tholin
Content: It turns out the C64 SID has two built-in ADCs, which I am trying to replicate in my recreation of it as well. Interestingly, they are implemented using just digital logic cells because they’re not true ADCs and are more like....resistance to digital converters. Each ADC pin requires a capacitor and resistor (usually a potentiometer) connected to it. The chip runs a loop of pulling those pins low for a bit, before tri-state-inputing them and running a timer until they register a logic one.
